name: Kelly R. MORRISON and Linda E. Morrison, husband and wife, Appellants, v. MOUNTAIN LAUREL ASSURANCE COMPANY, Progressive Casualty Insurance Company, Progressive Corporation, and Progressive Insurance Company, Appellees
name_abbreviation: Morrison v. Mountain Laurel Assurance Co.

judges: Before FLAHERTY, C.J., ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, SAYLOR, JJ.
Justice NIGRO and Justice NEWMAN did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
parties: Kelly R. MORRISON and Linda E. Morrison, husband and wife, Appellants, v. MOUNTAIN LAUREL ASSURANCE COMPANY, Progressive Casualty Insurance Company, Progressive Corporation, and Progressive Insurance Company, Appellees.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 21st day of May, 2001, this appeal is dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
Justice NIGRO and Justice NEWMAN did not participate in the consideration or decision of this case.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Louis M. Tarasí, Pittsburg, for Pennsylvania Trial Lawyers Association.
Dara A. DeCourcy, Pittsburg, Richard Hodyl, Jr.,, for National Association of Independent Insurers.
Kelly M. Tocci, Aliquippa, Michael B. James, for Kelly Morrison, et al.
Jeffrey A. Ramaley, Mark T. Caloyer, Dara A. DeCourcy, Pittsburg, for Mountain Laurel, et al.
casebody.head_matter:
772 A.2d 415
Kelly R. MORRISON and Linda E. Morrison, husband and wife, Appellants, v. MOUNTAIN LAUREL ASSURANCE COMPANY, Progressive Casualty Insurance Company, Progressive Corporation, and Progressive Insurance Company, Appellees.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 6, 2001.
Decided May 21, 2001.
Louis M. Tarasí, Pittsburg, for Pennsylvania Trial Lawyers Association.
Dara A. DeCourcy, Pittsburg, Richard Hodyl, Jr.,, for National Association of Independent Insurers.
Kelly M. Tocci, Aliquippa, Michael B. James, for Kelly Morrison, et al.
Jeffrey A. Ramaley, Mark T. Caloyer, Dara A. DeCourcy, Pittsburg, for Mountain Laurel, et al.
Before FLAHERTY, C.J., ZAPPALA, CAPPY, CASTILLE, SAYLOR, JJ.
